description:
Latvia
December 4th 2020
On Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays only these groups of products may be sold and purchased:

1) All types of products sold at pharmacies and veterinary pharmacies;

2) Fuel and all types of products at gas stations, except cigarettes, tobacco products and alcohol;

3) Stores may sell the following: food products, pet food, printed press, public transportation tickets, and hygiene products as follows:

    shampoos,
    toothbrushes, toothpaste, floss,
    soap,
    disinfection liquids,
    wipes and tissues,
    towels,
    tablecloths and napkins,
    hair brushes and other brushes for body care,
    feminine hygiene products,
    diapers and other childcare hygiene products,
    razors.

A list of hygiene products that may be traded is published on the website of the Ministry of Economics along with frequently asked questions by traders.

Pharmacies and veterinary pharmacies are allowed to open and sell their usual range of items.

The limitations apply also to markets and open-air sales. Fairs and Christmas markets may not take place at all.

On the other hand, distance trade and e-commerce are not restricted. The purchase of all goods with home delivery or to parcel terminals is allowed.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Supermarkets/grocery stores
institution_status: This type of business  ("Supermarkets/grocery stores") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Other condition not specified above (please provide detail in the text entry)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Latvia
December 19th 2020
"The amendments to the order emphasize in particular that anyone who is allowed to work remotely from home must do so. It is the employer's responsibility to provide this. These conditions apply to both public administration and municipal institutions and private companies. This means that salespeople, such as salesmen, drivers, stackers, police officers, firefighters, radio and television announcers and operators, doctors and others, but not, for example, office workers will work in person. "

description:
Latvia
December 3rd 2020
15 square meters per visitor must be provided in shops and service points. Information on the number of people allowed must be clearly visible at the entrance. In small rooms, visitors can go one by one.

Continuation of shops enforcing mask mandates

"...only pharmacies, including veterinary pharmacies, may operate on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays, while only groceries (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products and fuel may be sold in shops."

"On weekdays, everyone works with the same quadrature constraints. On Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays, sales points may not be open, except - pharmacies (including veterinary) and shops selling food (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products, fuel."

Subject to epidemiological safety measures, beauty care providers - hairdressing and manicure service providers - may operate. UPDATE: On December 3rd 2020 a policy was originally put into place limiting sales on weekdays, weekends, and holidays. Now as of December 19th 2020, these weekend/holiday rules will apply to the weekday as well.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Commercial Businesses
institution_status: This type of business  ("Commercial Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Hygiene and sanitation measures required,Restriction of number of customers,Restriction of business hours (if applicable note the hours of business in text entry)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Latvia
December 21st 2020
"However, as with open-air trails, open-air museum exhibits will still be open for visits.

It will also be possible to continue the activities of amateur art collectively only remotely - in cultural centers and other cultural places, the process of individual face-to-face attempts is interrupted.

The process of cultural education will also be fully organized remotely - the holding of individual lessons will also be interrupted in person.

Professional staff in the field of culture - theaters, concert organizations, museums, libraries, archives, cultural centers, etc. - will be able to continue in-person work only for those employees who are involved in the provision of live broadcasts or record-making; other employees will work remotely. "
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
Latvia
December 30th 2020
"These days, point-of-sale, catering and on-site service providers shall be closed no later than 21.00 so that employees can get to their place of residence in time. On the other hand, the opening hours of petrol stations and the provision of emergency and emergency utilities are not restricted. Other companies can also continue to operate on a business continuity basis, including shift work. "

Latvia
December 21st 2020
"However, as with open-air trails, open-air museum exhibits will still be open for visits.

It will also be possible to continue the activities of amateur art collectively only remotely - in cultural centers and other cultural places, the process of individual face-to-face attempts is interrupted.

The process of cultural education will also be fully organized remotely - the holding of individual lessons will also be interrupted in person.

" UPDATE: The policy had an ambiguous ending is now extended until January 25th 2021. As well, open air museums and exhibits must control the flow of traffic to prevent collision. All indoor cultural affairs remain unchanged.

description:
Latvia
December 3rd 2020
15 square meters per visitor must be provided in shops and service points. Information on the number of people allowed must be clearly visible at the entrance. In small rooms, visitors can go one by one.

Continuation of shops enforcing mask mandates

"...only pharmacies, including veterinary pharmacies, may operate on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays, while only groceries (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products and fuel may be sold in shops."

"On weekdays, everyone works with the same quadrature constraints. On Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays, sales points may not be open, except - pharmacies (including veterinary) and shops selling food (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products, fuel."

Subject to epidemiological safety measures, beauty care providers - hairdressing and manicure service providers - may operate. UPDATE: The policy was originally set to end on February 7th 2021, will now end on April 6th 2021
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Latvia
December 19th 2020
"The amendments to the order emphasize in particular that anyone who is allowed to work remotely from home must do so. It is the employer's responsibility to provide this. These conditions apply to both public administration and municipal institutions and private companies. This means that salespeople, such as salesmen, drivers, stackers, police officers, firefighters, radio and television announcers and operators, doctors and others, but not, for example, office workers will work in person. " UPDATE: The policy was originally set to end February 7th 2021 will now be extended until April 6th 2021

description:
Latvia
December 3rd 2020
15 square meters per visitor must be provided in shops and service points. Information on the number of people allowed must be clearly visible at the entrance. In small rooms, visitors can go one by one.

Continuation of shops enforcing mask mandates

"...only pharmacies, including veterinary pharmacies, may operate on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays, while only groceries (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products and fuel may be sold in shops."

"On weekdays, everyone works with the same quadrature constraints. On Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays, sales points may not be open, except - pharmacies (including veterinary) and shops selling food (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products, fuel."

Subject to epidemiological safety measures, beauty care providers - hairdressing and manicure service providers - may operate. UPDATE: Whereas prior, stores had heavy restrictions, now, as of April 7th 2021, select restrictions for smaller stores will be loosened...

"As a result, from April 7, the stores with the assortment of the product groups included in the product lists will no longer be open for on-site sales in the shopping centers. In turn, service providers in shopping centers will be able to continue to operate as before.

However, from April 7, regardless of the range of goods and retail space, all stores that have a separate entrance and are not located in a shopping center with a sales area of ​​more than 7,000 square meters will be able to open their doors to customers. All outlets will be able to operate in smaller shopping centers. Of course, both traders and buyers must comply with security requirements.

From April 7, the organization of street trade without entertainment events, such as themed parties and attractions, will also be allowed. Up to 20 traders may participate in such fairs and the organizer must ensure a distance of at least two meters between the stands, the flow of visitors and the demarcation of the territory."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

15 square meters per visitor must be provided in shops and service points. Information on the number of people allowed must be clearly visible at the entrance. In small rooms, visitors can go one by one.

Continuation of shops enforcing mask mandates

"...only pharmacies, including veterinary pharmacies, may operate on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays, while only groceries (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products and fuel may be sold in shops."

"On weekdays, everyone works with the same quadrature constraints. On Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays, sales points may not be open, except - pharmacies (including veterinary) and shops selling food (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products, fuel."

Subject to epidemiological safety measures, beauty care providers - hairdressing and manicure service providers - may operate. UPDATE: Whereas prior, stores had heavy restrictions, now, as of April 7th 2021, select restrictions for smaller stores will be loosened...

"As a result, from April 7, the stores with the assortment of the product groups included in the product lists will no longer be open for on-site sales in the shopping centers. In turn, service providers in shopping centers will be able to continue to operate as before.

However, from April 7, regardless of the range of goods and retail space, all stores that have a separate entrance and are not located in a shopping center with a sales area of ​​more than 7,000 square meters will be able to open their doors to customers. All outlets will be able to operate in smaller shopping centers. Of course, both traders and buyers must comply with security requirements.

From April 7, the organization of street trade without entertainment events, such as themed parties and attractions, will also be allowed. Up to 20 traders may participate in such fairs and the organizer must ensure a distance of at least two meters between the stands, the flow of visitors and the demarcation of the territory."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description:
Latvia
December 30th 2020
"These days, point-of-sale, catering and on-site service providers shall be closed no later than 21.00 so that employees can get to their place of residence in time. On the other hand, the opening hours of petrol stations and the provision of emergency and emergency utilities are not restricted. Other companies can also continue to operate on a business continuity basis, including shift work. " UPDATE: As of June 1st 2021 the policy is ending for those who have recovered or been vaccinated will be allowed to work on site.
Those not vaccinated are allowed to return but must be vaccinated by September 1st 2021/

description:
Latvia
December 19th 2020
"The amendments to the order emphasize in particular that anyone who is allowed to work remotely from home must do so. It is the employer's responsibility to provide this. These conditions apply to both public administration and municipal institutions and private companies. This means that salespeople, such as salesmen, drivers, stackers, police officers, firefighters, radio and television announcers and operators, doctors and others, but not, for example, office workers will work in person. " UPDATE: As of June 1st 2021, those vaccinated or recovered (and work in service points) may return to work. Those who are not yet vaccinated may also return to work but must be vaccinated by September 1st 2021.

description: Latvian government and public agencies (without further specification) will use remote methods of communication rather than face-to-face interviews wherever possible from March 12th
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services

description:
Latvia
April 20th 2020
With the reopening of some of Latvias treatments, the government has enlisted a new set of public guidelines for healthcare professionals.

At the same time, medical institutions must take a number of precautions. They will be able to provide these health care services from 9:00 to 16:00, providing a flow of individual patients. It will also be necessary to limit the number of patients staying on the premises of the treatment facility at the same time and to set a precise time of arrival for the healthcare.

Medical facilities will require both physicians and patients to provide personal protective equipment, and disinfection should be performed after each patient visit.

Medical authorities will also be required, as far as possible, to initially provide healthcare to those who have previously been discharged due to an emergency.

It should be emphasized that some planned health care services will still not be available in either public or private medical institutions. At the same time, as before, emergency medical and acute care will be provided, including the necessary examinations and consultations. GP practices also continue to work. Oncological, life-saving and disability-related operations will also continue to be provided.

Pregnant women, green corridor patients, HIV / AIDS and tuberculosis and others will also receive the help they need. As far as possible, consultations will be provided remotely.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
type_sub_cat: Other public facilities

Indoors, training can only be done individually - one coach and one client or a coach and more than one person if they are from the same household. There must be not less than 10 square meters per person for indoor training. Sport venues and sports clubs must close by 22:00.

Elite sports competitions for adult national team athletes and Olympic Sports Federation participants may take place, but only without spectators."

November 6th 2020
On weekends and public holidays, only certain retailers will be allowed to open. Shopping centers will open only grocery stores, pharmacies, veterinary pharmacies, animal feed stores, bookstores, press outlets, opticians, hygiene and household goods stores and telecommunications goods service points.

Retail outlets must provide 10 square meters per visitor and masks must be worn. Masks should also be worn in open market areas and street sales.

Opening hours are shortened from 06.00 to 20.00 for cultural venues and for exhibitions, churches and other religious places of activity.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: All Recreational or commercial events allowed to occur with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
November 6th 2020
"There will be no public sports events - competitions, demonstrations, shows, etc. No more than 10 people, excluding coaches, gather outside for sports training. Changing rooms must not be used. Indoors, training can only be done individually - one coach and one client or a coach and more than one person if they are from the same household. There must be not less than 10 square meters per person for indoor training. Sport venues and sports clubs must close by 22:00.

Elite sports competitions for adult national team athletes and Olympic Sports Federation participants may take place, but only without spectators." UPDATE: The policy initially begun on November 6th 2020 and set to end on December 6th 2020 will now be extended until January 11th 2021.

description:
Latvia
June 7th 2021
New regulations for those vaccinated or recovered...
- Up to 20 people at work premises and meetings in one room may not use a mouth and nose covering and do not need to observe a distance of two meters.
- Persons who have been vaccinated or have recovered from Covid-19 may participate in adult vocational training programmes held on site with up to 20 persons in a group, without the need to wear masks, observe physical distancing, etc.; however, ventilation of the premises remains obligatory.
- Persons who cannot confirm their full vaccination or recovery cannot participate in classes with those who have been vaccinated or those who have recovered from Covid-19.
- Training sessions of a permanent amateur sports group of up to 20 people may take place indoors.
- In one sports training (class) room, training is only allowed to take place for one group, and no persons that have not been vaccinated or have recovered from Covid-19 are allowed in the room.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: All Recreational or commercial events allowed to occur with conditions
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

UPDATE: The policy initially began on November 6th 2020 and extended several times will be phasing out May 27th 2021, and be mostly phased out by September 1st 2021. 
Public gathering restrictions will still be in place for unvaccinated and immune. However, those vaccinated and/or immune will have a different set of policies.

description: Latvian Transport Minister Tālis Linkaits announced that starting from March 27, 2020, additional measures will be implemented for regional bus routes to increase space between passengers and help observe social distancing. These measures will include restricting passengers to every other seat, and having them sit in scattered locations to minimize distance from all sides. Minibus passengers won't be able to use standing areas. No seats behind the driver will be used.  Road Transport Administration urges everyone not using transport for work purposes to reevaluate their need to travel.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on ridership of buses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 31 the Latvian government put a ban on people who have come to Latvia from abroad from using public transportation, having guests and going to meetings. 

The penalty for non-compliance with compulsory emergency epidemiological requirements will be up to EUR 2,000 for natural persons and up to EUR 5,000 for legal entities.

Latvia
April 20th 2020
With the reopening of some of Latvias treatments, the government has enlisted a new set of public guidelines for healthcare professionals.

At the same time, medical institutions must take a number of precautions. They will be able to provide these health care services from 9:00 to 16:00, providing a flow of individual patients. It will also be necessary to limit the number of patients staying on the premises of the treatment facility at the same time and to set a precise time of arrival for the healthcare.

Medical facilities will require both physicians and patients to provide personal protective equipment, and disinfection should be performed after each patient visit.

Medical authorities will also be required, as far as possible, to initially provide healthcare to those who have previously been discharged due to an emergency.

It should be emphasized that some planned health care services will still not be available in either public or private medical institutions. At the same time, as before, emergency medical and acute care will be provided, including the necessary examinations and consultations. GP practices also continue to work. Oncological, life-saving and disability-related operations will also continue to be provided.

Pregnant women, green corridor patients, HIV / AIDS and tuberculosis and others will also receive the help they need. As far as possible, consultations will be provided remotely.
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other public facilities
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
May 12th 2020
Minister of Culture implements guidelines for how Car-cinemas and Car-concerts should proceed, which include:
Cars being 2m apart
No leaving the car
One household per car
Only allowed to open windows to ventilate
There is a time limit of 6:30 to 24:00
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: Latvian Transport Minister Tālis Linkaits announced that starting from March 27, 2020, additional measures will be implemented for regional bus routes to increase space between passengers and help observe social distancing. These measures will include restricting passengers to every other seat, and having them sit in scattered locations to minimize distance from all sides. Minibus passengers won't be able to use standing areas. No seats behind the driver will be used.  Road Transport Administration urges everyone not using transport for work purposes to reevaluate their need to travel. UPDATE: An initial social distancing policy was put into place March 27th 2020 on all public transports in Latvia, now as of May 12th 2020, while some restrictions are relaxing it is now mandatory to wear a mask while on public transport.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on ridership of buses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

Cars being 2m apart
No leaving the car
One household per car
Only allowed to open windows to ventilate

description:
Latvia
June 9th 2020
"trading and public catering places, museums, exhibitions, and nature trails... In these places... the obligation to ensure an area of 4 m2 per person. 
There are additional conditions for public catering places: a distance of 2 metres must be ensured between the tables. Until 1 July, no more than 4 persons can sit at one table indoors and no more than 8 people at one table outdoors (for example, on terraces). 
As before, cultural, sports, entertainment, and religious places may start working no earlier than 6.30 and close no later than 24.00. Open-air cinemas and public catering places are an exception, as they must close no later than 2.00 a.m."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at All or unspecified businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
July 10th 2020
"...restriction for public catering establishments will be ... working no earlier than at 06.30 and must close no later than at 24.00"

"Catering establishments must still provide a distance of two metres between tables, as well as an area of at least 3 metres squared of public indoor space per visitor. Catering service providers must also, in a visible place, at least at the entrance, display information on the number of visitors allowed on the premises. "
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
July 10th 2020
"It is recommended to use mouth and nose coverings in places where it is not possible to keep a two metre distance from others, including on public transport. It is mandatory to use a mouth and nose covering when traveling by public transport to a place of self-isolation after returning from abroad. The use of a mouth and nose covering is also mandatory, if it is requested by private or public service providers or event organisers."

Latvia
August 1st 2020
"From 1 August, libraries, cultural centers, exhibition halls, open-air stages, theaters, concert halls, cinemas and outdoor events will have to keep a distance of one meter between fixed and personalized seats or install a barrier. description:
Latvia
August 17th 2020
New Corona regulations for cultural sites:
50% of the total possible number of people 
Infrastructure of the event or cultural service 3 m² area 
publicly available information on the maximum number of people allowed 
separate the flows of the groups of people present, not exceeding 300 people in each group; if achieved more than 50% can attend

If venue allows more than 500, precautionary measures must be drawn prior to event

Visitors of cultural sites will be able to sit together for two if they are not members of the same household; members of one household will be able to sit in a group of no more than four people.

Distance of 1 meter or the installation of a protective barrier between each of the two filled seating groups.
When leaving their seats, visitors to the event will have to continue to cover a distance of 2 meters.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Latvia
August 21st 2020
"During the Riga City Council elections, voters are encouraged to use a mouth and nose mask to protect themselves and others from the risk of becoming infected with Covid-19, but the use of a face mask is no longer mandatory in the current epidemiological situation. The face shield can be a cloth scarf, a face mask or a respirator. Voters will also be able to receive a disposable face mask at the polling station. "
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Other Mask Wearing Policy
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
August 21st 2020
"Voters will have to keep a distance of two meters and disinfect their hands while staying at the polling station. Voters are also invited to use their pen at the polling station. Pens will also be available at the station. "
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keep a distance of some other distance not listed above. Please note the distance in meters in the text entry.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

July 28th 2020

description:
Latvia
September 1st, 2020
The government rereleased guidlines for schools on COVID safety. 

From 1 September, schools must organize (A) face-to-face training. For the safe organization of the flow of people, they can take place (B) partially remotely. If a case of Covid-19 is detected in a school, there should be a plan to organize the training (C) completely remotely according to the of recommendations of the Ministry Education and Science .
- In schools, lunch breaks may be shorter than 30 minutes 
Additionally 

However, Kindergartens may be fully operational subject to epidemiological safety requirements
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

Latvia
July 10th 2020
"It is recommended to use mouth and nose coverings in places where it is not possible to keep a two metre distance from others, including on public transport. It is mandatory to use a mouth and nose covering when traveling by public transport to a place of self-isolation after returning from abroad. The use of a mouth and nose covering is also mandatory, if it is requested by private or public service providers or event organisers." Now, on October 7th 2020, masks are mandatory regardless of sickness status for those 13 and over on all public transport.

description:
Latvia
October 13th 2020
The Latvian government has decided that in order to curb the spread of Covid-19 it will be mandatory to wear face masks not only in public transport, but also in shops, pharmacies, post offices, museums, libraries, airports, bus stations and railway stations, as well as when visiting exhibitions and places of religious activities, such as attending church services. The requirement for face masks also applies to employees of these places who are not separated from visitors by a physical barrier, such as special walls. Also, the regulations already stipulate that a face mask must be used in places of service provision, where people stay longer than 15 minutes and it is not possible to keep a distance of 2 meters, and no other physical barriers have been created.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at All or unspecified businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Use of face covers became mandatory in public transport on 7 October, declares Latvian Government. UPDATE: While on October 26th 2020 saw the extension of mask mandates, it did not include school aged children. Now on November 3rd 2020, children 13 and up will have to wear masks where the mixing of classrooms occurs, such as lunch areas or hallways. It is not mandatory to wear masks in the classroom (with exception of the teacher)

description:
Latvia
November 9th, 2020
Under the second state of emergency announced by the Latvian government, measures are as follows: 
On-site public events (e.g. theaters, concerts, cinema screenings) are completely banned. Swimming pools, water parks, saunas and spas must close their doors. There will be no public sports events - competitions, demonstrations, shows, etc. Catering establishments may serve food only for pick-up, except in educational institutions, workplaces and at Riga Airport.. On weekends and public holidays, only certain retailers will be allowed to open. hopping centers will open only grocery stores, pharmacies, veterinary pharmacies, animal feed stores, bookstores, press outlets, opticians, hygiene and household goods stores and telecommunications goods service points.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Retail Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Latvia
November 9th 2020
State of emergency declared until Dec 6, 2020. Severe restrictions to protect the elderly in place:  "4.9. medical treatment institutions, social care institutions and places of imprisonment to restrict visits to the institution to third parties, except with the permission of the head of the institution for the provision of basic functions;"

October 13th 2020

description:
Latvia
November 27th 2020
"Significantly more stringent safety measures need to be prepared for residents in municipalities where the two-week total number of new Covid-19 infections per 10,000 inhabitants is twice the national average. The list of these municipalities will be published by the Center for Disease Prevention and Control on its website www.spkc.gov.lv every Tuesday.

As of November 27, the list includes: Varakļāni municipality, Aknīste municipality, Baldone municipality, Salacgrīva municipality, Krāslava municipality, Mārupe municipality, Mālpils municipality, Smiltene municipality, Garkalne municipality, Limbaži municipality, Salaspils municipality and Daugavpils city.
Stricter restrictions in the specified municipalities from November 27".
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all indoor spaces
target_geog_level: One or more cities within one or more countries
target_city: Varakļānu novads; Aknīstes novads; Baldones novads; Salacgrīvas novads; Krāslavas novads; Mārupes novads; Mālpils novads; Smiltenes novads; Garkalnes novads; Limbažu novads; Salaspils novada pašvaldība; Daugavpils pilsēta

description: Use of face covers became mandatory in public transport on 7 October, declares Latvian Government. UPDATE: Whereas a mandatory mask mandate was put into place October 2020, now on the 27th of November 2020 "Additional security measures will have to be provided in municipalities where the 14-day cumulative morbidity rate per 100,000 population in the previous week will be 50% higher than the national average. The number of passengers in the city's public transport will not exceed 50% of its capacity. In cases where, due to the nature of the vehicle, it is not possible to control the embarkation and disembarkation of passengers, the seats must be marked to ensure distance requirements. Additional security measures are specified in the Order of the Cabinet of Ministers “On Declaring a State of Emergency” and are in force from this year. November 27."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Public transportation
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
July 10th 2020
"It is recommended to use mouth and nose coverings in places where it is not possible to keep a two metre distance from others, including on public transport. It is mandatory to use a mouth and nose covering when traveling by public transport to a place of self-isolation after returning from abroad. The use of a mouth and nose covering is also mandatory, if it is requested by private or public service providers or event organisers." UPDATE: Whereas on the 11th of July 2020 a non-mandatory mask mandate was put into play, which, later in October changed several times over throughout the month to include more locations and making it mandatory, now on the 2nd of December 2020, the declaration of emergency has been extended and thus extending all social distancing policies within.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Public transportation
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
December 1st 2020
Stricter security measures are also being introduced in the field of education. The on-site learning process may take place only in kindergartens and 1-4. classes. description:
Latvia
December 3rd 2020
15 square meters per visitor must be provided in shops and service points. Information on the number of people allowed must be clearly visible at the entrance. In small rooms, visitors can go one by one.

Continuation of shops enforcing mask mandates

"...only pharmacies, including veterinary pharmacies, may operate on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays, while only groceries (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products and fuel may be sold in shops."

"On weekdays, everyone works with the same quadrature constraints. On Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays, sales points may not be open, except - pharmacies (including veterinary) and shops selling food (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products, fuel."

Subject to epidemiological safety measures, beauty care providers - hairdressing and manicure service providers - may operate.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Retail Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Latvia
December 3rd 2020.
"From December 3, everyone in Latvia must follow the 2 + 2 principle on a daily basis - two meters, two people. So a distance of two meters must be observed and meetings must be limited to two people.

No private events are allowed except within one household. People living alone and in need of care may follow the 2 + 2 principle."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keep a distance of some other distance not listed above. Please note the distance in meters in the text entry.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
July 10th 2020
"It is recommended to use mouth and nose coverings in places where it is not possible to keep a two metre distance from others, including on public transport. It is mandatory to use a mouth and nose covering when traveling by public transport to a place of self-isolation after returning from abroad. The use of a mouth and nose covering is also mandatory, if it is requested by private or public service providers or event organisers." UPDATE: Whereas an initial voluntary mandate was put into play, and later extended to those 13 and up, now as of December 3rd 2020, those 7 and up must wear a mask in public places
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Public transportation
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
December 3rd 2020
15 square meters per visitor must be provided in shops and service points. Information on the number of people allowed must be clearly visible at the entrance. In small rooms, visitors can go one by one.

Continuation of shops enforcing mask mandates

"...only pharmacies, including veterinary pharmacies, may operate on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays, while only groceries (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products and fuel may be sold in shops."

"On weekdays, everyone works with the same quadrature constraints. On Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays, sales points may not be open, except - pharmacies (including veterinary) and shops selling food (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products, fuel."

description:
Latvia
December 30th 2020
"These days, point-of-sale, catering and on-site service providers shall be closed no later than 21.00 so that employees can get to their place of residence in time. On the other hand, the opening hours of petrol stations and the provision of emergency and emergency utilities are not restricted. Other companies can also continue to operate on a business continuity basis, including shift work. "

Subject to epidemiological safety measures, beauty care providers - hairdressing and manicure service providers - may operate. UPDATE: Whereas prior one had to stay at home if and when possible, now as of March 1st 2021, manicure, pedicure, podiatrist and hairdresser services are allowed to operate in their saloons. Traveling operations are no longer allowed.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Financial service activities except insurance and pension funding
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Latvia
July 10th 2020
"It is recommended to use mouth and nose coverings in places where it is not possible to keep a two metre distance from others, including on public transport. It is mandatory to use a mouth and nose covering when traveling by public transport to a place of self-isolation after returning from abroad. The use of a mouth and nose covering is also mandatory, if it is requested by private or public service providers or event organisers." UPDATE: The policy was extended on December 3rd 2020 to January 11th 2021 and now as of January 8th 2021, policies will be kept in place until at least January 25th 2021 or February 7th 2021
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Public transportation
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

update_level_var: [compliance] of policy relaxing ; timing of policy strengthening
description:
Latvia
December 30th 2020
"These days, point-of-sale, catering and on-site service providers shall be closed no later than 21.00 so that employees can get to their place of residence in time. On the other hand, the opening hours of petrol stations and the provision of emergency and emergency utilities are not restricted. Other companies can also continue to operate on a business continuity basis, including shift work. " UPDATE: The policy was originally set to end January 11th 2021, has been updated to end on January 25th 2021, in addition to this extension, the policy now is only Friday evening to Sunday morning. Instead of Everyday
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside All or unspecified businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description:
Latvia
September 1st, 2020
The government rereleased guidlines for schools on COVID safety. 

From 1 September, schools must organize (A) face-to-face training. For the safe organization of the flow of people, they can take place (B) partially remotely. If a case of Covid-19 is detected in a school, there should be a plan to organize the training (C) completely remotely according to the of recommendations of the Ministry Education and Science .
- In schools, lunch breaks may be shorter than 30 minutes 
Additionally 

However, Kindergartens may be fully operational subject to epidemiological safety requirements UPDATE: Whereas in the original policy there was a code to follow to determine whether a school should be closed, full remote, or opened; and while other policies dictated various grade ranges switching to remote learning at different points, now on January 21st 2020 the government has decided ALL grades will be remote learning.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Latvia
December 1st 2020
Stricter security measures are also being introduced in the field of education. The on-site learning process may take place only in kindergartens and 1-4. classes. Schools must provide an area of ​​3 square meters per pupil. From December 3, those working in kindergartens must wear masks at all times UPDATE: While the original policy was to have in person classes with safety measures, now on January 19th 2020 it has been decided that grades 1 to 4 will be fully remote, starting January 25th 2020
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
02/02/2021
The Latvian government provided its stance on face shields

"   This means that people will be able to use medical or hygienic (cloth) face masks in the future. At the same time, face shields can be used to protect the mucous membranes of the eyes or the face from being touched by hand, but not to catch airway droplets. Therefore, they should only be used in combination with a face mask in the future.
"
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Other Mask Wearing Policy
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
September 1st, 2020
The government rereleased guidlines for schools on COVID safety. 

From 1 September, schools must organize (A) face-to-face training. For the safe organization of the flow of people, they can take place (B) partially remotely. If a case of Covid-19 is detected in a school, there should be a plan to organize the training (C) completely remotely according to the of recommendations of the Ministry Education and Science .
- In schools, lunch breaks may be shorter than 30 minutes 
Additionally 

However, Kindergartens may be fully operational subject to epidemiological safety requirements UPDATE: While prior the policy was set to end when the state of emergency ended or situations cleared up, the government has stated it will extend and keep all policies at least until April 6th 2020.
Individual on-sites for 12th graders, vocational, and university is possible when not possible to do online.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Latvia
December 3rd 2020
15 square meters per visitor must be provided in shops and service points. Information on the number of people allowed must be clearly visible at the entrance. In small rooms, visitors can go one by one.

Continuation of shops enforcing mask mandates

"...only pharmacies, including veterinary pharmacies, may operate on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays, while only groceries (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products and fuel may be sold in shops."

"On weekdays, everyone works with the same quadrature constraints. On Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays, sales points may not be open, except - pharmacies (including veterinary) and shops selling food (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products, fuel."

Subject to epidemiological safety measures, beauty care providers - hairdressing and manicure service providers - may operate. UPDATE: The policy was originally set to end on February 7th 2021, will now end on April 6th 2021
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Retail Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

"...only pharmacies, including veterinary pharmacies, may operate on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays, while only groceries (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products and fuel may be sold in shops."

"On weekdays, everyone works with the same quadrature constraints. On Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays, sales points may not be open, except - pharmacies (including veterinary) and shops selling food (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products, fuel."

Subject to epidemiological safety measures, beauty care providers - hairdressing and manicure service providers - may operate. UPDATE: The policy was originally set to end on February 7th 2021, will now end on April 6th 2021
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Commercial Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Latvia
December 30th 2020
"These days, point-of-sale, catering and on-site service providers shall be closed no later than 21.00 so that employees can get to their place of residence in time. On the other hand, the opening hours of petrol stations and the provision of emergency and emergency utilities are not restricted. Other companies can also continue to operate on a business continuity basis, including shift work. " UPDATE: The policy was originally set to end February 7th 2021, will be extended until April 6th 2021
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside All or unspecified businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)

description:
Latvia
July 10th 2020
"It is recommended to use mouth and nose coverings in places where it is not possible to keep a two metre distance from others, including on public transport. It is mandatory to use a mouth and nose covering when traveling by public transport to a place of self-isolation after returning from abroad. The use of a mouth and nose covering is also mandatory, if it is requested by private or public service providers or event organisers." UPDATE: Whereas the policy was changed to mandatory and extended to February 7th 2021, now on February 11th 2021, all policies are extended again until April 6th 2021
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Public transportation
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

update_level_var: [compliance] of policy relaxing ; timing of policy relaxing
description:
Latvia
September 1st, 2020
The government rereleased guidlines for schools on COVID safety. 

From 1 September, schools must organize (A) face-to-face training. For the safe organization of the flow of people, they can take place (B) partially remotely. If a case of Covid-19 is detected in a school, there should be a plan to organize the training (C) completely remotely according to the of recommendations of the Ministry Education and Science .
- In schools, lunch breaks may be shorter than 30 minutes 
Additionally 

However, Kindergartens may be fully operational subject to epidemiological safety requirements UPDATE: Whereas earlier, the policy was extended until April 6th 2021, now the policy is returning to its routes and is based per the city.

Consequently, the Cabinet of Ministers has conceptually agreed on a regional approach in the field of education. A detailed decision should be made at the meeting of 18 February [2021], however, it is planned that local governments, where the cumulative number of new infections does not exceed 200 for a two-week period, may decide to resume full-time education for 1st-4th year students. At the same time, schools must meet a number of epidemiological safety requirements.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On February 23, The cabinet of ministers in the Latvian government adopted a decision on the conditions for a gradual transition to the safe provision of services in the beauty sector, on the resumption of small shops (up to 300 m2) , subject to epidemiological safety measures, as well as on changes in other areas. Service providers must report their activities to the Health Inspectorate. The government has yet to discuss a date from which to allow small shops to operate.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
February 26th, 2021
At the meeting of the Ministry of Culture on Friday, February 26, 2021, the Latvian government decided to allow individual consultations in the acquisition of vocational education programs, observing the safety requirements set by epidemiologists. The consultation may last for a maximum of 40 minutes, during which the teacher and the learner use a mouth and nose cover and keep a distance of two meters.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
September 1st, 2020
The government rereleased guidlines for schools on COVID safety. 

From 1 September, schools must organize (A) face-to-face training. For the safe organization of the flow of people, they can take place (B) partially remotely. If a case of Covid-19 is detected in a school, there should be a plan to organize the training (C) completely remotely according to the of recommendations of the Ministry Education and Science .
- In schools, lunch breaks may be shorter than 30 minutes 
Additionally 

However, Kindergartens may be fully operational subject to epidemiological safety requirements UPDATE: The prior policy allowed for some schools to open early when numbers of infection were low.
Now, From March 16 [2021], work will continue in pre-school education institutions, admitting only those children whose parents have to work full-time, as well as those whose nature of work makes it impossible to work remotely and provide childcare at the same time. In pre-school education, staff should use mouth and nose pads properly during and outside the learning process.

In order to protect the health of both employees and children, it is planned that a pre-school Covid-19 test is performed on pre-school employees.

In lengthy discussions, the Cabinet of Ministers cautiously decided to allow up to five formal education sessions and up to two non-formal education sessions per week for a group of up to 20 people per year in the municipalities where the 14-day cumulative morbidity rate per 100,000 people does not exceed 250. The duration of one lesson does not exceed 40 minutes.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

September 1st, 2020
The government rereleased guidlines for schools on COVID safety. 

From 1 September, schools must organize (A) face-to-face training. For the safe organization of the flow of people, they can take place (B) partially remotely. If a case of Covid-19 is detected in a school, there should be a plan to organize the training (C) completely remotely according to the of recommendations of the Ministry Education and Science .
- In schools, lunch breaks may be shorter than 30 minutes 
Additionally 

However, Kindergartens may be fully operational subject to epidemiological safety requirements UPDATE: The prior policy allowed for some schools to open early when numbers of infection were low.
Now, From March 16 [2021], work will continue in pre-school education institutions, admitting only those children whose parents have to work full-time, as well as those whose nature of work makes it impossible to work remotely and provide childcare at the same time. In pre-school education, staff should use mouth and nose pads properly during and outside the learning process.

In order to protect the health of both employees and children, it is planned that a pre-school Covid-19 test is performed on pre-school employees.

In lengthy discussions, the Cabinet of Ministers cautiously decided to allow up to five formal education sessions and up to two non-formal education sessions per week for a group of up to 20 people per year in the municipalities where the 14-day cumulative morbidity rate per 100,000 people does not exceed 250. The duration of one lesson does not exceed 40 minutes.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Latvia
February 18th, 2021
On 18 February 2021, supporting the principle of full-time study regions proposed by the Ministry of Education and Science, it was agreed that it will be possible to resume face-to-face training in those municipalities where the incidence of Covid-19 is less than 200 patients per 100,000 population. Conditions are: students from grade 1 must wear masks, schools provide regular ventilation of the premises, distance between classes, non-overlapping classes, disinfection measures, and an algorithm developed by the Health Inspectorate. Covid-19 testing is mandatory for on-site staff. Educators in high-risk groups - with chronic illnesses and seniors from the age of 60 - can work remotely until a vaccination against Covid-19 is started, in agreement with the head of the educational institution.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

update_level_var: [compliance] of policy relaxing ; timing of policy relaxing
description:
Latvia
September 1st, 2020
The government rereleased guidlines for schools on COVID safety. 

From 1 September, schools must organize (A) face-to-face training. For the safe organization of the flow of people, they can take place (B) partially remotely. If a case of Covid-19 is detected in a school, there should be a plan to organize the training (C) completely remotely according to the of recommendations of the Ministry Education and Science .
- In schools, lunch breaks may be shorter than 30 minutes 
Additionally 

However, Kindergartens may be fully operational subject to epidemiological safety requirements UPDATE: Whereas prior, classes for preschool could operate under certain circumstances and some schools could open when under the 250/100,000 threshold now...

Kindergartens will continue to operate on-site after April 7[2021]. To reduce the risk of Covid-19 spread, workers should adhere to epidemiological safety requirements, including the use of mouth and nose pads. Kindergarten staff will continue to be tested once a week.

At other levels of education, learning is provided remotely, but with a few exceptions, with education as one of the government's priorities and children's psycho-emotional health. From April 7, in municipalities where the two-week morbidity rate per 100,000 people does not exceed 200, face-to-face training can be organized for 1-6. and 12th grade students. 7.-11. For pupils in the classroom, full-time studies may take place on a rotating basis so that the classes do not overlap in the educational establishment. In order to resume full-time studies, the educational institution must provide epidemiological requirements and weekly testing of staff.

Individual face-to-face counseling will still be available throughout Latvia for 12th grade students and those at risk of dropping out, and for those who have to take state examinations in the first half of 2021. On-site consultations take place only at the individual invitation of the teacher in accordance with the epidemiological safety procedure. The consultation time should not exceed 40 minutes.

In municipalities where the number of new Covid-19 infections per 100,000 inhabitants exceeds 200 in two weeks, 12th grade students will be able to attend on-site training no more than two days a week in the subjects where the centralized examinations are taken. Up to 5 face-to-face classes per week can be organized for students of other classes in these municipalities, up to a maximum of 10 people per group.

From April 7, it will be possible to organize face-to-face classes for groups of up to 10 people in vocational education, interest education and artistic collectives
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Latvia
December 30th 2020
"These days, point-of-sale, catering and on-site service providers shall be closed no later than 21.00 so that employees can get to their place of residence in time. On the other hand, the opening hours of petrol stations and the provision of emergency and emergency utilities are not restricted. Other companies can also continue to operate on a business continuity basis, including shift work. " UPDATE: Whereas prior, all catering was closed, now as of April 1st 2021 catering is only allowed for outdoor venues when the infection numbers are appropriately low.
Otherwise, it is takeaway.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside All or unspecified businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
December 3rd 2020
15 square meters per visitor must be provided in shops and service points. Information on the number of people allowed must be clearly visible at the entrance. In small rooms, visitors can go one by one.

Continuation of shops enforcing mask mandates

"...only pharmacies, including veterinary pharmacies, may operate on Saturdays, Sundays, and public holidays, while only groceries (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products and fuel may be sold in shops."

"On weekdays, everyone works with the same quadrature constraints. On Saturdays, Sundays and public holidays, sales points may not be open, except - pharmacies (including veterinary) and shops selling food (except alcohol and cigarettes), hygiene products, fuel."

Subject to epidemiological safety measures, beauty care providers - hairdressing and manicure service providers - may operate. UPDATE: Whereas prior, stores had heavy restrictions, now, as of April 7th 2021, select restrictions for smaller stores will be loosened...

"As a result, from April 7, the stores with the assortment of the product groups included in the product lists will no longer be open for on-site sales in the shopping centers. In turn, service providers in shopping centers will be able to continue to operate as before.

However, from April 7, regardless of the range of goods and retail space, all stores that have a separate entrance and are not located in a shopping center with a sales area of ​​more than 7,000 square meters will be able to open their doors to customers. All outlets will be able to operate in smaller shopping centers. Of course, both traders and buyers must comply with security requirements.

From April 7, the organization of street trade without entertainment events, such as themed parties and attractions, will also be allowed. Up to 20 traders may participate in such fairs and the organizer must ensure a distance of at least two meters between the stands, the flow of visitors and the demarcation of the territory."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Retail Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Latvia
July 10th 2020
"It is recommended to use mouth and nose coverings in places where it is not possible to keep a two metre distance from others, including on public transport. It is mandatory to use a mouth and nose covering when traveling by public transport to a place of self-isolation after returning from abroad. The use of a mouth and nose covering is also mandatory, if it is requested by private or public service providers or event organisers." UPDATE: Whereas prior the policy was made mandatory to wear masks; and then social distancing was required on buses by reducing occupancy and later amount of transports was increased to accommodate; and the policy had multiple extensions, now on April 1st 2021, the government of Latvia has determined regardless of the Declaration of Emergency, some policies such as masks on transports and social distancing will remain in effect well past easter.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Public transportation
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
April 29th, 2021
On  April 29, 2021 the Latvian government approved amendments for final examination for obtaining general secondary education which will take place in person. Exams for obtaining general secondary education will be held starting on May 11 2021, however, their number has been reduced. In order to obtain a certificate of general secondary education this year and also next year, students will not necessarily have to take the fourth or optional exam. Professional qualification exams are planned for June 2021(participants during this time will be no more than 10).
Regulations are as follows: testing must be carried out(only those testing negative may attend), distance and hygiene requirements must be observed, as well as personal protective equipment must be used by everyone during the exams, including mouth and nose covers. No more than 25 students may be present in one exam room, but the presence of up to 40 students is allowed in an appropriately sized school hall.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia 
May 15th, 2021
On May 15th 2021, the Latvian government approved amendments for conducting entrance exams in general education institutions. The amendments clarify how entrance exams for admission to formal education programs at the basic and secondary education level may take place in person. When organizing the entrance exam, there may be no more than 10 people in one group, those present in and outside the exam room use mouth and nose covers and keep a distance of two meters. For the purpose of additional security, the amendments also provide for the conduct of Covid-19 tests. In order to participate in the entrance exam in person, the Covid-19 test must be taken within the last 72 hours before the entrance exam. The Covid-19 test may not be performed if a person can documentally prove that they have been infected with SARS CoV-2 in the last three months and no longer pose a risk of infection to others. Also, the Covid-19 test is not carried out by persons who can document that they have been fully vaccinated against the Covid-19 infection.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
September 1st, 2020
The government rereleased guidlines for schools on COVID safety. 

From 1 September, schools must organize (A) face-to-face training. For the safe organization of the flow of people, they can take place (B) partially remotely. If a case of Covid-19 is detected in a school, there should be a plan to organize the training (C) completely remotely according to the of recommendations of the Ministry Education and Science .
- In schools, lunch breaks may be shorter than 30 minutes 
Additionally 

However, Kindergartens may be fully operational subject to epidemiological safety requirements UPDATE: Whereas prior classes were allowed to take place in select locations that fell below the infection rate of 200/100,000, now June 2nd 2021,
Education

In order to implement the mandatory requirement for maintaining the qualification and to ensure the possibility to acquire the practical part of continuing professional education programs, qualification practice, passing the professional qualification examinations, as well as the practical part of professional development programs, groups of up to 10 people At least 3 m premises must be ensured in the training premises 2 per person, 2 m distance between persons and ventilation of the . Learners and teachers should use face fees. Participation in face-to-face classes is possible with a negative Covid-19 test result.

At the same time, it should be noted that persons who have been vaccinated or have contracted Covid-19 with a certificate may attend full-time adult vocational training programs in a group of up to 20 people, without complying with the requirements for wearing masks, distance, etc., except ventilation.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Other; please list other enforcement mechanisms in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Latvia
December 30th 2020
"These days, point-of-sale, catering and on-site service providers shall be closed no later than 21.00 so that employees can get to their place of residence in time. On the other hand, the opening hours of petrol stations and the provision of emergency and emergency utilities are not restricted. Other companies can also continue to operate on a business continuity basis, including shift work. " UPDATE: As of June 1st 2021 the policy is ending for those who have recovered or been vaccinated will be allowed to work on site.
Those not vaccinated are allowed to return but must be vaccinated by September 1st 2021/
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside All or unspecified businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
July 10th 2020
"In order to reduce possible crowding, the condition regarding the number of people at one table has also been restored, meaning that no more than 4 persons are allowed to be at one indoor table and no more than 8 persons at an outdoor one." UPDATE: Whereas prior it was mandatory that you had to wear masks while sitting at the table, now on June 6th 2021, those vaccinated sitting at a table with other vaccinated people do not have to wear a mask.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on visiting other locations
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Latvia
June 29th, 2021
On June 29, 2021, the Latvian government supported the proposal prepared by the Ministry of Education and Science to allow sports training for students of interest education and vocational education programs also indoors. The proposal to increase the number of people who can be at the outdoor sports competition venue at the same time was also supported. As long as the 14-day cumulative number of Covid-19 cases per 100,000 inhabitants does not exceed 120, 500 people will be able to be at the sports competition venue outdoors at the same time instead of the previous 300. The requirement to comply with a certain m2  will depend on the epidemiological situation - as long as the 14-day cumulative number of Covid-19 cases per 100,000 does not exceed 120, one person will have to provide not 25 m2 , but 15 m2 in the training (lessons) of sports students 2   of the available area, and the requirement of 20% of the maximum possible number of people will not have to be met.
The time of sports training (lesson) may not exceed 90 minutes, changing rooms may not be used, except in public swimming pools, if the filling in the changing rooms does not exceed 25% . Students under the age of 5 may not be involved in sports training (lessons) , except for students in the swimming training program.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory (Unspecified/Implied),Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

description:
Latvia
December 1st, 2020
On December 1st, 2020, the Latvian government announced that from 4 January 2021, masks must be worn in schools, both during and outside the classroom, for both pupils and teachers. While the age group was not explicitly mentioned, the on-site learning process which may take place only in kindergartens and 1-4 from December 3 would be abiding by this policy change.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
